subject: Business
title: Cost Leadership vs. Differentiation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cost Leadership vs. Differentiation usable.

hook.text: Walmart and Apple both dominate. One wins on price. The other wins on everything but price.

buildup.text: Porter identified two generic strategies: be the cheapest (cost leadership) or be unique (differentiation).

discovery.text: Cost leaders strip out extras and optimize relentlessly. Differentiation leaders add value customers pay more for.

twist.text: Getting stuck in the middle â€” not cheapest, not unique â€” is the most dangerous position of all.

climax.text: IKEA defied Porter by doing both: unique design at low cost through flat-pack efficiency.

punchline.text: Be the cheapest or be the best. Never be neither.

quiz.question: What does Porter warn about being 'stuck in the middle'?
options: It's the most dangerous strategic position
It's the safest path for new companies
